articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf, Ankika Biswas, Shashwat Chauhan
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes fell on Wednesday, deepening a pullback in equities, as rising Treasury yields kept investors on edge about the path ahead for interest rates.
articles.title: Wall Street slide deepens as elevated yields keep market on edge

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) union plans to strike additional Detroit Three automotive facilities on Friday absent serious progress, a source told Reuters.
articles.title: UAW plans to strike additional auto targets Friday absent serious progress - source

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The top U.S. markets regulator on Wednesday told Washington lawmakers that a looming shutdown of the federal government would reduce his agency's staffing to "skeletal" levels, blocking it from approving companies' Wall Street debuts and hindering its ability to respond to any market turmoil.
articles.title: As shutdown looms, companies should go public 'before Friday'-US SEC chief

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: ChatGPT users will now be able to surf the web, Microsoft-backed (MSFT.O) OpenAI said on Wednesday, expanding the data the viral chatbot can access beyond its earlier September 2021 cutoff.
articles.title: ChatGPT users can now browse internet, OpenAI says

articles.author: Jeffrey Goldfarb
articles.description: Wall Street is getting ready to move on from the Jeffrey Epstein saga. JPMorgan (JPM.N) just agreed to fork out $75 million to the United States Virgin Islands over allegations that the giant bank helped facilitate the late sex offender’s human trafficking operations. The resolution adds to other hefty sums from a mess that also cost two prominent industry chief executives their jobs. Absent any further repercussions, however, the sordid affair will soon fade from financial memories, like so many others before it.
articles.title: Jeffrey Epstein leaves small mark on Wall Street

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Volkswagen (VOWG_p.DE) was hit by a major IT outage on Wednesday, Europe's top carmaker said, adding that production at the carmaker's namesake brand in Germany had come to a halt as a result.
articles.title: Volkswagen hit by IT outage, brand vehicle production in Germany halted

articles.author: Arunima Kumar, Sourasis Bose
articles.description: A U.S. Senate committee on Wednesday voted to advance a marijuana banking bill, raising hopes for the cash-dependent cannabis sector to get access to regular banking services.
articles.title: Cannabis banking legislation moves forward in US Senate

articles.author: Scott Murdoch, Julie Zhu, Rae Wee
articles.description: The chairman of China Evergrande Group (3333.HK) has been placed under police surveillance, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, raising more doubts about the embattled developer's future as it grapples with mounting prospects of liquidation.
articles.title: Evergrande chairman under police watch; liquidation risk mounts

articles.author: Tim Reid
articles.description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump's rivals are running out of time to halt his march to the 2024 Republican presidential nomination unless one emerges as a clear alternative in their second debate on Wednesday, party strategists say.
articles.title: Time running out for Trump's Republican 2024 rivals as they face off in second debate

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Five members of an Arab family were shot dead in their home in Israel, police said on Wednesday, in the latest in a wave of crime-related killings in Israel's Arab communities that has reached a new peak this year.
articles.title: Arab family of five shot dead as crime rates in Israel soar
